name: Mathematics: Analysis and Approaches HL
description: Mathematics: Analysis and Approaches emphasizes algebraic methods and mathematical abstraction. HL is designed for students who enjoy developing mathematical arguments and solving problems, particularly those planning to study mathematics, physics, or engineering.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 1
assessmentComponents.description: Short and extended response questions (no calculator)
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: Short-response questions. Section B: Extended-response questions. Total 110 marks.
markingCriteria: Method marks even if final answer incorrect

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 2
assessmentComponents.description: Short and extended response questions (calculator required)
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: Short-response questions. Section B: Extended-response questions. Total 110 marks.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 3
assessmentComponents.structure: Two questions each worth approximately 30 marks. Tests problem-solving and mathematical reasoning.

assessmentComponents.name: Internal Assessment
assessmentComponents.description: Mathematical Exploration - investigating an area of mathematics (12-20 pages)
assessmentComponents.structure: Criteria: Presentation (4), Mathematical communication (4), Personal engagement (3), Reflection (3), Use of mathematics (6). Total 20 marks.

assessmentObjectives.description: Knowledge and understanding - recall and use of facts, techniques and methods
Problem solving - investigate unfamiliar situations using mathematics
Communication and interpretation - mathematical language and forms
Reasoning - construct mathematical arguments and proofs

iaGuidelines: The Mathematical Exploration should be on a topic that genuinely interests the student. It should go beyond the syllabus in depth rather than breadth. Topics should allow for personal engagement and mathematical analysis at an appropriate level for HL.
